{"step_by_step_thinking": "Rosettes are a histopathological feature seen in certain types of tumors. They are not typically seen in neurocysticercosis, which is a parasitic infection, not a tumor. Medulloblastoma and PNET are both types of neuroectodermal tumors, and while they can sometimes show rosette formation, it is not a defining feature. Retinoblastoma, on the other hand, is a type of tumor that often shows rosette formation, specifically Flexner-Wintersteiner rosettes.", "answer_choice": "A. Retinoblastoma"}
